metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9118 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PHP 7.1.5 has an Out of bounds access in php_pcre_replace_impl via a crafted preg_replace call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
libphp7.4-embed - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bcmath - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10
php7.4-bz2 - 7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10

notes.Note: leosilva> unfixed upstream as of 2020-06-23 rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 retriage on 2022-02-01 found that upstream fixed it on 2021-11-29, information is now updated to reflect this. xenial (php7.0) returns an oom instead of crashing while running the poc from the php bug tracker, but the vulnerable code is present and the patch is applicable.

criterions.comment: php7.4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.3-4ubuntu2.10').
